39456555.review: Great little Match 3 Game, very worth the price

39437104.review:
Just completed the game close to 100% (all skills unlocked, all levels 3 starred, and two characters 1 level to max.)

The game is promising, the idea of matching gens and clearing them to unleash special abilities, heal or deal damage is old-school but still entertaining and fun to play, at least for a while. Ok, so you play the game with three different characters, they have different special abilites, some of them were slightly similar but overall it has a good mix. As you progress into the game, you earn things like gold and, if I didn't remember wrongly, some sort of green mgical powder, they can be used to upgrade the character and purchase some special abilites. There is also some special abilites and special clothings to be won in combats and specific levels, so it works a bit like a purchase-upgrade kind of game, which I found pretty entertaining. 

The game's storyline is fairly long considering its playstyle, the foes you will be facing will have different powers, whether it is to deal damage to you or interfere with your matching game. Those little perks are very nice but does get a bit repetitive towards the end. Although I really wanted to see the ending when I first start playing it, but I got a bit bored and had to put it down for like a few months before picking it back up and completeing the full game.

There are people out there who looks strongly at the ACG/Anime aspect of the game, so I will make a few comments regarding it. The ACG are nice, definitely not disappointing. As mentioned earlier, there is a variety of "skins" for the characters, but it is also sort of limited I would say. The big ACG pictures which you can collect upon toggling certain cutscenes, and view at the gallery at the game menu is not that "attractive", personally that's what I thoguht. But hey, when I played quite a long time ago, I don't actaully remember that being there, so I have to give the developments credit for their update(s) and the little perks they added in there.

Overall, a nice matching-and-clearing game. Graphics are decent and at the moment, I haven't been experiencing any lag or bugs(there is a little option to adjust the graphic quality, if anyone is experiencing any lag, they could check that feature out). I think I got it on a discount..? I can't really remember, but even at its full price, I think it is worth recommending.

39427029.review:
Toujours peu enclin à ce type de jeu orienté "coquin", j'ai cependant du installer (et jouer) à [b]Hell Girls[/b] par simple politesse, une amie Steam me l'ayant offert. Il s’avéra que cela ne fut pas une si mauvaise expérience. Non exempt de défauts, Hell Girls m'apporta néanmoins une poignée d'heures de divertissement.

Commençons de façon académique cette review. [b]Hell Girls[/b] est donc un jeu de match 3, un peu plus libre que les standards du genre. En effet ici, vous pouvez relier n'importe quel symbole semblable, même diagonalement. Cela donne ainsi lieu à de gigantesques combos. Les symboles sont au nombre de six : cœur (santé), bouclier (défense),  orbe (magie), épée (attaque physique), étoile (attaque magique) et grimoire (permet de multiplier son combo existant). Vous l'aurez compris, chaque symbole vous obtiendra une capacité différente, que ce soit pour récupérer de la vie ou pour attaquer votre adversaire.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1272992891

Vous avez le choix tout au long du jeu entre trois héroïnes : [b]Feu[/b], [b]Foudre[/b] et [b]Glace[/b] ; que vous pourrez switcher à loisir. Chacune a donc ses spécificités et est plus efficace face à tel ou tel groupe d'ennemis. Personnellement, je suis resté avec [b]Glace[/b] (pardonnez-moi mais son nom exact m'échappe), les autres étant trop faibles. Vous avez l'opportunité, avec l'expérience acquise en combat, d'améliorer nettement les capacités de votre séide mais au détriment des deux autres qui resteront à un stade de développement préhistorique.

Je passe sur le pitch du jeu que vous découvrirez mais il est tellement connoté et faiblard qu'il ne mérite même pas de s'y attarder. Une sombre histoire de monstres et de sauvetage d'univers en somme. Vous arrivez donc sur une carte où de nombreux combats sont disponibles et à la victoire de ceux-ci, la carte se découvre un peu plus entièrement. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1272992707

La difficulté est assez relevée, du moins dans les premiers combats et il vous faudra batailler ferme pour l'emporter. Une fois la carte finie après 5h de bons et loyaux services, nous arrivons ici au passage qui m'a plus qu'hérissé. 
En effet, un peu lassé par le jeu et ce temps passé dessus, je me suis retrouvé sur une deuxième carte où chaque héroïne doit faire un nombre présélectionné de combat. Et plus question de changer de personnage ici. Que nenni, je m'armais de courage et je décidais de continuer l'aventure. Oui mais voilà, [b]Feu[/b] et [b]Foudre[/b] que je n'avais jamais "upgradées" se sont faites défoncer plus rudement qu'une pucelle offrant ses services à une armée en marche. Je n'avais donc d'autre choix que de retourner sur la carte de base et refaire moult fois les combats déjà gagnés avec ces deux zessegon... Que je périsse si je m'y risque ! Je l'ai donc désinstallé. Faut pas me prendre pour un cornichon, morbleu.

Au niveau des succès maintenant. C'est également la plus vaste plaisanterie de l'univers connu. Ils sont au nombre de 92 (on sent déjà ici que le jeu baisse la culotte pour attirer les complétionnistes). Vous débloquez les succès plus vite que votre serviteur essayant de semer les perdreaux avec sa puissante et magnifique BMW. C'est vous dire... Il s'avère donc qu'à la première carte finie (soit à 50% du jeu), vous les avez déjà tous débloqués. M'enfin, ça devrait faire plaisir à certains.

Finissons cette évaluation par le prix qui reste une bonne surprise. Il est périodiquement en soldes à moins d'un euro, ça peut être une bonne affaire à condition que le combo répétitivité/femmes frivoles ne vous fasse pas fuir à toutes jambes.

[code]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]

39510844.review:
I know a lot of people say this, but I genuinely play these games for the gameplay. Yes, I'm serious.

That being said, Hell Girls is a rather enjoyable Match-3 game that is completely worth the 2€ I paid for it. You get to level up the characters and buy new skills to be used during the puzzle section with currency you earn after every "fight", even if you happen to lose it. The "fights" can be a bit challenging at times, but that usually just means that you need to level up your character, use a different character, or just... well, got a bad start.

I suppose if you're into "hot anime tiddy", you'll also enjoy the little CGs (which can be changed with an 18+ patch, which I didn't use and thus can't comment on) and some of the extra outifts you unlock by getting 3 Stars in specific "fights" (the outfits also boost/decrease specific stats/skills). As for me, I just enjoyed mindlessly matching some symbols to murder monsters while listening to youtube videos rather than the game I was playing.

There are a few problems with the game, less so with the gameplay itself though. When I start it and try to enter a "fight"/click on one of the character portraits to check/increase stats or change skills, the game will freeze up for a few seconds, as though it's struggling to load. Sometimes, from what little I played actually listening to the game, the music will glitch out - usually when there's dialogue inside of the "fight" itself. The music itself isn't bad, but pretty repetitive (as well as the soundclips of the three girls), but hey, if it annoys you, you can always do the same as me and listen to something else instead!

The writing is also... rather poor, but honestly, most people probably don't buy this game for a well-written, enticing story that ropes you right in and keeps your interest, right? As a matter of fact, it's the kind of clichéd "bad" that makes it pretty amusing again. You know, the kind of writing you'd see in "ecchi anime" a lot of the time. I got a chuckle out of it once or twice, and it's not really a big negative point for me for this specific kind of game at all. I didn't expect anything super deep for a Match-3 game.

All in all, a fun game to play now and again with okay graphics and only minor flaws that I can overlook. For anyone who cares about achievements, they are also easy to obtain and mostly limited to "make a chain that consists of x amount of symbols", "destroy x amount of symbols at once", "level up x character x times" and "collect/buy x amount of skills for each character". I got them all fairly quickly.

39599511.review:
[h1]Механический фейл[/h1]

Неординарная "три-в-ряд" смешанная немного с рпг. Но на деле оказывается, что игра очень и очень непродуманная.

Во-первых, гринд. Да, дети, это "три-в-ряд" с гриндом, потому что  здесь откровенно важен лвл ваших героинь, чтобы они тащили самые спорные ситуации на своих характеристиках. И всё бы ничего. Есть даже отдельная локация, которая вроде как способствует фарму ресурсов нужных (по сути нужен только 1-й ресурс, требуемый для прокачки, золота же в игре навалом и девать некуда). Но фарм убивается уже непосредственно убитой механикой.

Второе.
В игре есть "книжки заклинаний". Спеллбуки. Они появляются рандомно вместо существующих элементов на игровом поле, но потом начинают в 90% случаев появляться уже лишь на рандомном месте после зачистки клеток цепочкой, где уже была какая-то книжка. Таким образом они как бы есть всегда, что должно быть хорошо.
А ещё есть игровая механика, которая говорит "опустить объект N в самый низ, чтобы разобраться с ним". Это может быть как награда (а если вы упускаете сундучки, хотя бы 1 штуку даже, то готовьтесь что получите на 60% меньше ресурсов в конце или ещё меньше), так и олицетворение способностей мобов. У мобов это обычно работает в виде "пока не опустите его [Тотем] на самое дно сетки, он будет или портить вам жизнь, или  по истечению таймера снесет 1к хп разом".
А теперь о том что из этих идей вышло в совокупности.
Появляются бонусные сундуки \ опасные объекты от мобов на сетке.
И вам нужно опустить их на дно.
Лучше всего в этом помогают как раз "Книжки заклинаний".

И вот вы зачищаете до самого низа, разбиваете книжку, которая удерживает важные элементы над собой. И на её месте появляется ещё одна книжка. Разбиваете эту - появляется следующая. Таймер идёт. Книжки не хотят спавнится нигде больше, кроме как в месте куда нужно опускать объекты.
И, чёрт подери, с этим ничего не сделать, вообще!

И всё из-за того, что место появление книжек определяется ДО того как объекты начинают опускаться на опустошенные клетки. И всё. Одна маленькая недоработка превращает больше половины сражений в отвратительную каторгу по борьте с игровой механикой, когда игра требует от вас что-то сделать, но делает это просто невозможным.

Дисклеймер для ачивкофилов:
- Вам не потребуется проходить даже половины игры, чтобы открыть все достижения

[h1]Оценка: [b]2.0[/b][/h1]

Сначала терпимо и даже приятно, но вскоре получает статус "неиграбельно".

40916731.review:
This game is ridiculously addictive! In all, i sunk a good 12 hours into it - collecting all the outfits, skills, and beating the final boss. Which i think is a good amount of content for £1.59. 

As others have said though, if you're here for fanservice alone you're gonna be disappointed. Besides the slightly questionably drawn boobs and jiggle physics, there are only 5 fanservicey images. The first is thrust in your face about a minute in, but the others follow a long, distinctly ladyless stretch where you actually have to play the game, so that might turn some people off. 

The gameplay though! A lot of people will find it hard or boring - at least at first -  but i actually really enjoy the battles in this game. There's enough variety and strategy involved that keeps them interesting, as well as loot to find (which adds to your star rating and amount of exp and gold you receive at the end of the battle) and other incentives like skill and level upgrades. Like other RPGs however, there's quite a lot of grinding and sometimes winning and losing comes down to getting good RNG, wearing the right outfit, choosing the right girl, or praying to the right deity to please not let that eyeball wizard thing get another disruption off. Pretty please. He only has 100 HP left (He haunts me in my sleep). 

Uhh. Anyway... Speaking of choosing the right girl - there are three to choose from:

Fire maiden - Your starting girl. She's a warrior type, boasting excellent physical attack, decent HP, and terrible magical attack. Each girl has special skills they can use if they match spell books, and Fire Maiden's is just to start blowing stuff up around the area matched. I think a lot of the game's difficulty comes from using her, since getting good exp from fights involves collecting treasure (you have to use your special spell book attacks to destroy the loot) and her special attack is never in the right place to do the job, and doesn't have a wide area of effect. I always bench her immediately. Sorry Fire maiden! 

Lightning Maiden - The squishy mage. She has terrible HP, excellent magical attack, and surprisingly, the highest armour of all the girls. Her special skill involves nuking any loot, block or disruption tile on the board. Lighting Maiden is a beast! Once she gained a few levels she basically carried the game for me. She's the girl you want when you need to collect loot, since her skill always hits its target no matter where the spell book is on the board. As a downside though, you have to play more defensively with her since she takes longer to kill monsters than the others, and can withstand less damage. 

Ice Maiden - Jack of all stats. She has equal physical and magic attack (half as good as Fire and Thunder's respectively) and excellent HP. Her spell book attacks destroy rows and columns - more accurate than Fire's spell with a much larger area of effect. She's the character i relied on early game until Lighting became less squishy, then late-late game when (spoilers) you gain the ability to switch between girls for like 2 battles. She's also the best when it comes to dealing with damage-dealing disruptions like poison and fire, since she can tank the damage pretty well. 

Also, despite the elemental rock, paper, scissors the game implies by giving you girls of different elements, i'm almost positive that it never comes into play. I played as Ice Maiden against fire enemies and they never seemed to do extra damage to me, so...

Hell girls! 

Basically, to wrap this overly long review up... it's a fun game! A bit grindy, but once you know which battles give the most exp (the Colosseum on the first map. It gives like 8000 spirit points or w/e if you get both loots) you can level up your girls super quick with little trouble. If there are criticisms to be made, it's about the text - the translation is passable, but sometimes the text cuts off in the middle of a sentence, rendering it impossible to understand the story. If the devs fixed that it would be great.

40864726.review:
Honestly, this is rather dull. 

The game has you playing bejewled to fight monsters, but it gets extremely repetitive. 
You're stuck chipping away at a monsters health through very rng luck based praying that the [strike] Candy	[/strike] [strike] Tokens	[/strike] [strike]Yoshi's cookies	[/strike] Whatever blocks fall in such a way that you do any sort of damage.

You go through an entire map doing this, leveling up, getting dresses and only wearing one for some sort of stat gain and getting skills to use during each battle.

This would be fine if it wasn't so repetitive.

The mechanics of each monster is extremely interesting to be fair, but this is offset by how many times you'll see them or how long due to them most likely having enough health for you to be matching 15x combo damage blocks and only see a sliver of it go down.

You know the kicker? 

That's only the 1st map. I finished the 1st map, not knowing it was the 1st map, when the game decided to inform me that i'd have to do it all over again except in a new area.

So, no. I quit there and you'd understand me if you for some reason still want to try this.

40856802.review:
后期续命定身流玩法。冰女必带三技能：幻化、冰冻、高级治疗。穿泳装。

利用高级治疗术的强力续命增加场上的存活时间，利用冰冻和泳装加成能延迟敌人四回合的时间。再利用幻化技能幻化药水方块增加魔法值用来无限冰冻。本身冰冻就有一定的伤害，如果蓝富裕还可以使用输出魔法增加伤害，基本无敌的组合。所以建议资源全都倾泻在冰女身上。

我用这套打发四个5回合的boss点，除了第一轮需要运营一波外，第二波开始就是完全无伤碾压。

不过缺点是消耗回合太多，核心就是个拖。通关解锁成就推荐玩法。

再来说说游戏。前期比较简单，中期开始难度上升。不过我发现了续命大法后通关就没有任何难度。游戏进入后期后就开始变得有些无聊了。

角色3d建模水平还行，bikini泳装的款式不是很喜欢。不过CG非常精致，缺点是解锁方式不明。到现在才刚解锁两张。

还算不错的休闲游戏，11元钱买来不亏。。

全通关，第二面难度提升一点，三个妹子会和之后的怪都是四只一起的。第二面的技能有升级的版本，注意及时更换。

40855706.review:
아무 생각없이 시작했다가 의외의 게임성에 시간을 보내게 되는 '지옥소녀' 라는 게임입니다. 시작과 동시에 3명의 소녀가 같이 다니면서 오만 몬스터에게 시비털고 다니는 내용인데, 정확히는 마계에서 살던 생물들이 늘어나는 인구와 좁아터진 공간, 그리고 생활공간의 척박함을 견디다 못해, 보다 나은 삶을 영위하고자 지상세계에서 자리를 잡고 살아가려고 했음에도 불구하고 동족이 아닌 존재를 용납하지 못하는 인간의 편협함으로 무장한 세 명의 여자애들에 의해 처참하게 짓밟히고 유린당하는 내용이 되겠습니다. 

일러스트나 이벤트에 대해서는, 궁금하신 분들이 많을 터인데, 그냥 그렇습니다. 그 나이대의 소녀라면 누구나 할 법한, 지극히 평범한 내용으로 구성되어 있으며 (현실과는 다르게)그러한 행위 자체도 많진 않다는 점에서 십대소녀들에 대한 환상을 가지신 분들의 꿈과 희망도 지켜드릴 수 있었다고 감히 평가드릴 수 있습니다. 게다가 게임하다 보면 그런 건 전혀 신경쓰지 않게 되는 것도 사실이고요.

아무튼 가격대비 괜찮은 게임입니다. 특히 880원에 살 수 있다는 걸 감안한다면 더욱 그렇습니다. (카드 팔면 대충 400원은 나옵니다. 그러면 실제로는 500원 정도에 산 셈이죠)



덧: 매치3이라는 생소한 태그가 무엇을 뜻하는 것인지는 잘 모릅니다만, 아마도 뿌요뿌요 같은 종류를 뜻하는 것인 둣합니다.

40840262.review: What can I say.... this game is GODLY. Oh you thought the Witcher 3 was good? Thought Skyrim was pretty great? Nope, make way PLEBIANS as I show you quite possibly the best game ever made, Hell Girls. I only had to play an hour to realize that this was no ordinary game, it might as well be real life. Not ONLY are the graphics indistinguishable from real life, but the moans of the anime women are SPOT ON. The story is IMPECCABLE, with you crushing spiders and other creatures that stand in the way of some end goal. Overall I give this game a 10/11. If you are looking for a match game, you should leave now.  If you are looking for a game about anime women fighting goblin CHADS then you have come to the right place!

40598431.review: The main problem with this game is that 99% of the stuff implemented in it seem to have the sole purpose of preventing you from doing actual things. Outfits aren't useful, your abilities seldom make up for the enemies' ones and in-game progress doesn't go far from repeating the same battles over and over again until you get an advantageous starting board, you can afford an upgrade or you're just lucky. As the difficulty increases, cul-de-sac situations become more common and it culminates around the 2nd map where after a few turns you can easily have half of the board blocked in different ways, being able to do nothing except from watching the opponent abuse their tricks and doing nothing in return.

40486763.review: 作为小黄油的话来说，算不上是一个福利多多的类型，仅有的几张CG福利性也不是很高，不过当初折扣买下的时候本也就不是抱着特别高的期望。和《Mirror》的消除方式不太一样，不过也是款不错的消消乐游戏。看见评测区很多吐槽强度不均的，其实的话，可以蛮顺利打到地狱章节的。地狱章节方面个人认为这样设计的强度就主要是考虑对于游戏的理解性了，三位角色各有各的特点，这是游戏剧情里一直强调的，所以看懂了这一点我觉得地狱方面就不算太难了。（个人觉得火焰作用不大，主要打一打血量较厚的特殊方块。雷电主要打散位消除，灵活性较大。冰雪主要对付这游戏内比较恶心的下落型方块。个人无聊时玩一玩已经满星结局通关了）对于技能的使用配置有一定的考究，还有魔法书生成点的选择，如果想要满星过关的都需要考虑一下。总的来说，算是一款可以用来无聊时动动脑子打发时间的消消乐游戏。

40389277.review:
Hell Girls is a puzzle game with RPG elements. You play as 1 of 3 maidens, whose job it is to close the 3 portals of hell to stop monsters flooding the land. The game doesn’t take itself too seriously, and mixes few different mechanisms to make itself different from a lot of the other games out there.

Gameplay wise the game isn’t too bad, but becomes repetitive after a few hours. Luckily you shouldn’t really need more than this to finish the game- as each of the battles shouldn’t take more than 3-5 minutes each. The goal is to match up as many gems of the same type in a continuous chain, and deal damage to the enemy and hopefully destroy the enemy’s spells that are on the board. All pretty basic so far.

To break things up each of the maidens deals primary damage in a different way. The fire maiden uses the physical gems, lightning maiden uses the magic gems, cold the ice maiden gets no bonus to either but has more health. I instantly thought that she would be like having a 3rd person on a date (eg completely useless) but I was proven wrong. Each of their spell books works differently as well (explosions destroying circles of gems, lightning targeting certain gems or rows and columns being destroyed). I managed to brute force my way through the first world with the fire maiden alone, I should have paid more attention and worked out which monsters were weak to each maiden special- it would have saved me some time later on. You can also level up each maiden (increase stats), change costumes (change modifiers for the character of magic spells), and change what magic they can cast in battle. So unlike other puzzle/gem games it has a little bit more going on under the hood. There are 3 minor quests that can be done, that will reward each of the maidens with a more advanced spell book that they wouldn’t normal be able to access until the beginning of world 3. You also purchase additional spells from shops dotted over the map.

You have 3 worlds to clear, the first which can be done with any maiden, the second locks each maiden into about 5 fights each, and the third lets you switch which maiden is in play during battle (I thought that was good), but the amount of fights here is very limited.

Graphicly, the game looks like something that would play on a mobile phone or 3ds with 3d monsters looking like the blocky creatures similar to what is in the early final fantasy remakes. It does it well, but the moving monsters and maidens can be distracting, and seeing the maidens (who look all of 16) fight in bikinis made me put them back in other clothing- no matter what stat penalty I was going to take. There are boob physics on the maidens, and those things are all over the place- they could use them as weapons to beat the monsters into submission, they move so much it was comical. There are about 3-4 music tracks for this game, and I noticed that you can easily pick when the music loops and starts again. I thought that was disappointing, it’s the first time I’ve heard that happen in these types of games (from what I’ve played them usually fade nicely into restarting). I did have one menu open behind another screen, essentially forcing me to exit the game to continue. I also noticed that some of the monster abilities hadn’t been translated from Chinese. The current end boss battle was good, but it seemed unfinished (goes on about needing to defeat a god, but you don’t fight a god at all).

If you are looking for H content, there’s a minimal amount, so that that offends you or that’s what you want this game for you would be better off looking elsewhere.

There’s a ton of achievements for this game if you are looking for 100%, and all of them are easy to get. I'll put a recommend on it, if only because I got the game for like under $1 and it provided a few hours distraction.

40321708.review:
[h1]Short but decent game. Good for playing during Q-times or while waiting for downloads.[/h1]

That being said you [i]can[/i] play this game even without waiting for something in the background, but it is really short and fun will be over much sooner than you think. This is because the main problem I had with this game are the achievements. I wouldn't have bought such a game if it did not have achievements, simply because I need some kind of additional progression and reward system when playing this genre (speaking of genre, it's a mix between strategy and gem-puzzle, which is entertaining at first).

To get every single achievement you don't even have to play through the entire game: You don't have to complete every level, you don't need to collect every piece of clothing. The only "difficult" achievements, making a X-chain of gems aren't even that difficult, since you can come back to easier levels later on when you leveled up your characters, making it literally impossible for the monsters there to kill you, giving you all the time you need to smartly put gems with the "luck" skill together for the said X-chain.

Generally, I would recommend this game, since the 6 hours I spent playing it during Q-times were more entertaining than sitting in the main menu and looking at my different heroes. But if you're looking for a challenge, don't try this game.


Thanks for reading!
[i] A guide by ΗΑΖΞ [/i]

40219241.review:
I enjoyed the game, so I give it a thumb up, but it doesn't mean that issues in the game can go unmentioned:

- All the games that SakuraGame published has bad English translation, and this game is no exception. Like every other game, the text is littered with weird wordings and grammatical errors, and some of the text is not visible due to overflow.
- The events in the game are very few, or maybe it was because most of them are minor and forgettable. The story is more or less a crappy excuse for the game anyway.
- You would need to explore a bit to equip your skill after buying them.
- The CGs in this game is spread quite far apart. You get the first one at the beginning of the game, and you won't get the others until you beat a portion of the second map.

The game can be completed (reach ending and unlock all achievements) in around 7+ hours. It was a bit repetitive, but I didn't need to grind past levels to proceed, since I was able to 3 star most of the the fights and get maximum reward, plus the bonus which comes with completing key events. I finished the game with all 3 girls at level 12, and grind for 2 hours to max their level at the Colosseum.

40130871.review:
●●我推薦這遊戲，但是建議特價入手，幾杯飲料錢，推薦原因如下，一定要看！

●●我是看中遊戲性而買，對於遊戲遊玩過程感覺不錯。整體而言感覺良好～

●●H部分，只有6張CG圖，我只解鎖三張，如果不打18補丁，那麼也就只是一般日本動漫賣肉番的滿滿聖光(障礙物)。

●●遊戲等級後期提升一等，等級需求經驗+2,000。

●●為了H而買，我不建議，遊戲說起來內容很薄，大部分時間都在練等、刷裝、刷星。

●●數值方面可改動，大大縮短遊戲時間(自行搜索)，但是我基於數值好看緣故(等級各方面一起提升)，正常遊玩。

●●最後如果喜歡刷怪賺經驗，連合珠子那這遊戲很適合你，H部分就當作不存在吧！(存在感薄弱)頂多就是立繪漂亮。

40130661.review:
The gameplay is actually quite a lot of fun. It's not your standard match-3 game where you swap gems; in this one you're connecting chains and when you pull off one that's 10 or 12 gems long it's pretty great. I can see how it'll get boring eventually, but I've played about an hour now and I imagine I'll get at least another couple hours out of it. Considering I paid 79 cents for it, I'm happy.

As far as I can see there's not any sexual content, just three anime girls in anime outfits. If that's a problem for you... did you know you can just go on Google and search for "naked anime girls"?

40099023.review: Hell Girls popped up on sale for .79 cents so I figured, "why not?" and bought it. I Played for 3 hours at the time of writing this, and I have to say it's actually a fun little match-um-up. It's got some comedy in the dialogue, neat gameplay with skills to use and huge combos to line up, and (with patch) sprinkled with some naughty bacon bits on top. In my opinion, Hell Girls is definitely worth the purchase even at full price.

un match 3 de base et une des versions la plus commune du match 3
les graphismes sont plus que moyens
l'histoire il y'en a pas...
vous me direz... sakura game... ils ont fait un bel effort, ils ont fait autre chose que... rien du tout, mais ça n'est pas bien different de ce qu'ils font d'habitude finalement
des filles en maillot de bain et.... et, et bien rien du tout
des succès steam, trop facile a avoir, la fin du jeu et quelques pics legèrement érotique...

bref, j'ai très rarement vu autand d'évaluation sur un jeu match 3 et je suis un fan du genre, pour dire... des filles en maillots de bain sur un jeu de merde et tout le monde achète et tout le monde trouve des excuse bidon pour dire qu'il est bien
genre de mec binoclar qui bave comme des malade en voyant une filles et disent a leurs copain "ooooh regarde UNE FILLE" QI d'un poisson rouge

39679319.review:
選択したキャラクターによって、アイテムを使った際のスキルが違うパズルゲーム。
どういう攻撃をしてくる敵にはこのキャラクターで・・・という戦略があると攻略が楽になるから、詰まったと思ったらキャラクターを変えるのもいいかも。
レベルアップがだるいのは難点だけど、パズルゲームとしては十分楽しめる。

あと、実用性は・・・パッチでイラストが変わるので、値段分は十分にあるかと。
ただ、雷＞炎＞＞＞氷って感じなので、氷が好きな人は物足りないかも。
何が、とは言わないが。
